thread.title: Kim Jong-un's brother, Kim Jong-nam, 'assassinated in Malaysia' by female attackers
thread.title_full: Kim Jong-un's brother, Kim Jong-nam, 'assassinated in Malaysia' by female attackers

title: Kim Jong-un's brother, Kim Jong-nam, 'assassinated in Malaysia' by female attackers
text:
World Kim Jong-un's brother, Kim Jong-nam, 'assassinated in Malaysia' by female attackers Kim Jong Nam, eldest son for former leader of country, reported to have been poisoned by two women. February 14, 2017 12:05 GMT Kim Jong-Nam, the eldest son of former North Korean leader Kim Jong-Il in 2010 JoongAng Sunday/AFP 
The half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un has been assassinated in Malaysia, according to reports. 
South Korea news agency Yonhap and other media organisations are reporting that Kim Jong-nam has died, citing several South Korean government officials. 
News channel TV Chosun said Kim was poisoned at Kuala Lumpur airport by two women believed to have been North Korean operatives. 
A second report from Malaysian police said that a man believed to be Kim died en route to a hospital after falling ill at the capital's airport. 
Kim is the eldest son of late former leader Kim Jong-il but did not live in North Korea or hold any official title. He was born from his father's relationship with Sung Hae-rim, a South Korean-born actress who died in Moscow, reported Yonhap.
